items.title: Premier League buildup and latest football news ‚Äì matchday live
items.summary: ‚öΩ All the latest in the buildup to Saturday‚Äôs action ‚öΩ Ten things to look out for | Tables | Mail us here Continental corner: There are some eye-catching games around the European leagues today, no less than Real Madrid v Sevilla (8pm GMT) which rounds off the day in La Liga. Dortmund went second in the Bundesliga last night but RB Leipzig can reclaim the position if they beat fourth-placed Leverkusen at 5.30pm. In Serie A, Juventus v Roma (7.45pm) is fifth v fourth but both sides will have designs on the top three. The Coupe de France takes centre stage in, well, France, with PSG, Lille, Lorient and Toulouse among the top flight sides in action, going away to lower league opponents. Continue reading...

items.title: Newcastle make four changes as Hall starts vs Chelsea LIVE!
KKD-scherpschutter Robin van Duiven kan PSV inruilen voor Spaans avontuur
items.summary: Robin van Duiven (20) is in trek. De spits van Jong PSV is topscorer van de Keuken Kampioen Divisie. Real Valladolid wil de aanvaller wegkapen uit Eindhoven, bevestigen ingewijden. Al zijn er meer kapers op de kust.

items.title: Have England blinked with Bazball approach en route to Ashes defeat?
items.summary: Michael Atherton believes "England have blinked" in terms of their Bazball approach to batting as they stare at an Ashes series defeat with two Tests to play.

items.title: Schouten snapt nieuwsgierigheid Veerman naar transfer
items.summary: Bij PSV kwam afgelopen transferzomer, vlak voor het sluiten van de markt, een bod van bijna dertig miljoen euro binnen op Joey Veerman (27) van Brentford. Tot zijn teleurstelling kwam er geen deal, maar Veerman wil nog altijd een keer een buitenlands avontuur aangaan. Daar kan Jerdy Schouten, zijn teamgenoot en aanvoerder van PSV, wel begrip voor opbrengen.

items.title: Guardiola heeft g√©√©n inspraak in opvolger bij Man City
items.summary: Pep Guardiola hoeft zich bij Manchester City niet te bekommeren over zijn opvolger. De Catalaan staat al lang aan het roer bij de Britse topclub, maar voorzichtig wordt er gespeculeerd over het einde van zijn tijdperk. Zelf is de manager niet bezig met zijn erfenis, gaf hij aan in een persconferentie. Guardiola wil 'gewoon' de Premier League winnen en ziet dan wel verder.

items.title: Nederlandse herinneringen aan Gascoigne: 'Het was absurd, een halve bom'
items.summary: Vanwege de recente verschijning van Eight, een biografie over het roerige (voetbal)leven van Paul Gascoigne, vroeg VI zijn drie Nederlandse teamgenoten van weleer naar hun herinneringen. Hun anekdotes geven een beeld van een onnavolgbare voetballer, altijd op zoek naar de lach.

items.title: McTominay in de bres voor Man Utd: 'Toen ik daar speelde, deden ze alles'
items.summary: Scott McTominay (29) werd afgelopen seizoen de beste speler van de Serie A. Bij Napoli was de middenvelder nauwelijks af te stoppen en won hij de Scudetto. Dat gebeurde na zijn vertrek bij Manchester United, maar de Schot nam het deze week t√≥ch op voor zijn oude liefde.

items.title: Crawley: No one in England camp would criticise Brook reverse-sweep dismissal
items.summary: Zak Crawley says no one in the group would ever criticise the nature of his England team-mate Harry Brook's dismissal after the batter was out reverse sweeping in the third Ashes Test.

items.title: Salah apologised to Liverpool players - Jones
items.summary: Mohamed Salah's angry outburst is "in the past" and "just part of wanting to be a winner", says his Liverpool team-mate Curtis Jones.

items.title: Manchester United target R√∫ben Neves and Conor Gallagher as January signings
items.summary: Antoine Semenyo thought to favour move to Liverpool Neves would cost around ¬£20m but wages may be issue Manchester United are monitoring Al-Hilal‚Äôs R√∫ben Neves and Atl√©tico Madrid‚Äôs Conor Gallagher as potential January signings to strengthen Ruben Amorim‚Äôs squad. Bournemouth‚Äôs Tyler Adams is also of interest but any deal for the American is not likely until the close season. United are also vying with Liverpool and Manchester City to sign Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth in early January but the forward is thought to favour joining Liverpool, with City his second choice, so Amorim faces a fight to convince him. Continue reading...

items.title: Paul taken to hospital with 'double broken jaw' after AJ heavyweight defeat
items.summary: Jake Paul has confirmed his jaw was broken in two places during his defeat to Anthony Joshua in Miami.

items.title: Ousmane Demb√©l√© quietly becomes the main man after long journey to the top
items.summary: The Frenchman, who has been named the best male footballer in the world by the Guardian, has benefitted from PSG‚Äôs focus on the team rather than individuals What makes a good player great, and a great player the best? This question has been occupying me since 2014, when the Guardian first asked me to contribute to its inaugural Next Generation feature. My job was to look for a France-based talent born in 1997 who could go on to have a stellar career. After a great deal of research, I narrowed it down from my shortlist of five by asking questions not about the players‚Äô football ability, but about other attributes: resilience, adaptability, decision-making, creativity, work ethic, response to feedback and willingness to learn. Qualities we cannot see, and are harder to measure. Continue reading...

items.title: Dubois showcases power in dominant world title win
items.summary: Caroline Dubois floored Camilla Panatta in the sixth round as Britain's WBC lightweight champion defended her title with a dominant points win.

items.title: 'Most attacking keeper in league' - why Raya is key for Arsenal
items.summary: David Raya has been described as the most attacking goalkeeper in the league by Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta. BBC Sport analyse the importance of the Spaniard.

items.title: Mancini, sibling rivalry and wanting to excite fans - the Yaya Toure story
items.summary: Yaya Toure reflects on a glittering career at clubs such as Barcelona and Manchester City as well as with his country, Ivory Coast.

items.title: Laurens' weekend preview: Mbapp√©'s quest to overtake Ronaldo, Spurs-Liverpool search for form, more
items.summary: What is Julien Laurens watching this weekend? For starters, Kylian Mbapp√©'s quest to make Madrid history, plus the Africa Cup of Nations kicks off.

items.title: USMNT's Adams (torn MCL) out up to 3 months
items.summary: United States international Tyler Adams will be out for up to three months after tearing a medial collateral ligament, Bournemouth coach Andoni Iraola said Friday.

items.title: Arteta on Arsenal future: I have to earn new deal
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has hinted he could stay at Arsenal beyond his current contract but suggested he would have to earn any new deal.

items.title: PSG GK fractured hand during shootout heroics
items.summary: Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Matvey Safonov has been left with a fractured hand following his penalty shootout heroics to win the Intercontinental Cup.
